pli-tv-pvr1.1:0.4.eng: Questions and answers on the monks’ Pātimokkha rules and their analysis

pli-tv-pvr1.1:0.5.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

pli-tv-pvr1.1:1.1.eng: Homage to the Buddha, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One

pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena paṭhamaṃ pārājikaṃ kattha paññattaṃ, kaṃ ārabbha, kismiṃ vatthusmiṃ?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.1.eng: “The first offense entailing expulsion was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down? Whom is it about? What is it about?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.2.eng: Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.2.comm: Sp 5.2: Ayañhi anuppannapaññatti nāma anuppanne dose paññattā; sā aṭṭhagarudhammavasena bhikkhunīnaṁyeva āgatā, aññatra natthi, “Laid down when no fault has occurred, this is called anuppannapaññatti. It has come down for the nuns on account of the eight important principles. There are no other cases.”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.3.eng: Is it a rule that applies everywhere or in a particular place?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.4.eng: Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common or not in common?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.5.eng: Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.6.eng: In which of the five ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it contained and included?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.7.eng: In which recitation is it included?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.8.eng: To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.9.eng: To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.10.eng: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.11.eng: To which of the four kinds of legal issues does it belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.12.eng: Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues is it settled?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.13.pli: Ko tattha vinayo, ko tattha abhivinayo?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.13.eng: What is the Monastic Law there? What is concerned with the Monastic Law there?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.14.pli: Kiṃ tattha pātimokkhaṃ, kiṃ tattha adhipātimokkhaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.14.eng: What is the Monastic Code there? What is concerned with the Monastic Code there?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.18.pli: Kati atthavase paṭicca bhagavatā paṭhamaṃ pārājikaṃ paññattaṃ?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:2.18.eng: For how many reasons did the Buddha lay down the first offense entailing expulsion?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena paṭhamaṃ pārājikaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.1.eng: “The first offense entailing expulsion was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.6.pli: Sudinno kalandaputto purāṇadutiyikāya methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.6.eng: Sudinna having sexual intercourse with his ex-wife.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.7.eng: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.8.eng: There is one rule. There are two additions to the rule.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.8.comm: Sp 5.2: Dve anupaññattiyoti “antamaso tiracchānagatāyapī”ti ca, “sikkhaṁ apaccakkhāyā”ti ca makkaṭivajjiputtakavatthūnaṁ vasena vuttā – imā dve anupaññattiyo, “Two anupaññattiyo is said because of the accounts of the female monkey and the Vajjians. These are the two additions to the rule: ‘even with a female animal’ and ‘without first renouncing the training’.”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.10.eng: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere or in a particular place?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.11.comm: Sp 5.2: Sabbatthapaññattīti majjhimadese ceva paccantimajanapadesu ca sabbatthapaññatti, “Sabbatthapaññatti: both in the central Ganges plain and in the outlying countries, this is sabbatthapaññatti.”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.12.eng: “Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common or not in common?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.14.eng: “Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.15.comm: Sp 5.2: Byañjanamattameva hi ettha nānaṁ, bhikkhūnaṁ bhikkhunīnampi sādhāraṇattā sādhāraṇapaññatti, ubhinnampi paññattattā ubhatopaññattīti, “For here merely the wording is different, since a commonality between the monks and the nuns is a common rule, whereas a ruling for both is a rule for both sides.” The point seems to be that a rule “in common” is synonymous with a rule “for both”.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.16.eng: “In which of the five ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it contained and included?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.17.comm: Sp 5.2: Nidānogadhanti “yassa siyā āpatti so āvikareyyā”ti ettha sabbāpattīnaṁ anupaviṭṭhattā nidānogadhaṁ; nidāne anupaviṭṭhanti attho, “Nidānogadha: it is contained in the introduction because of the entry here of all offenses: ‘Anyone who has committed an offense should reveal it.’ The meaning is they are entered in the introduction.”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.19.comm: Sp 5.2: Dutiyena uddesenāti nidānogadhaṁ nidānapariyāpannampi samānaṁ “tatrime cattāro pārājikā dhammā”tiādinā dutiyeneva uddesena uddesaṁ āgacchati, “In the second recitation: being contained and included in the introduction, it comes to be recited with ‘Now these four rules on expulsion’ etc.”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.20.eng: “To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.22.eng: “To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.23.eng: The class of offenses entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.24.eng: “Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.26.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.26.eng: from body and mind, not from speech.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.27.eng: “To which of the four kinds of legal issues does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.28.eng: Legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.29.eng: “Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues is it settled?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.31.eng: by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.32.pli: Ko tattha vinayo, ko tattha abhivinayoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.32.eng: “What is the Monastic Law there? What is concerned with the Monastic Law there?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.33.eng: The rule is the Monastic Law. Its analysis is concerned with the Monastic Law.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.33.comm: Sp 5.2: Vibhattīti padabhājanaṁ vuccati; vibhattīti hi vibhaṅgassevetaṁ nāmaṁ, “The word analysis is called vibhatti; for vibhatti is a name for the analysis.” The first of these refers to the Pātimokkha, which is mentioned in the next entry, whereas the latter refers to the vibhaṅga. This shows us that the prefix abhi- means “about” in certain contexts, such as this one, and refers to a commentary style text. It may well be, then, that the Abhidhamma, which is sometimes paired with abhivinaya in the Canonical texts, originally was regarded as a commentary on the content of the Sutta Piṭaka.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.34.pli: Kiṃ tattha pātimokkhaṃ, kiṃ tattha adhipātimokkhanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.34.eng: “What is the Monastic Code there? What is concerned with the Monastic Code there?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.35.eng: The rule is the Monastic Code. Its analysis is concerned with the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.41.pli: “Na evarūpaṃ karissāmī”ti yāvajīvaṃ āpāṇakoṭikaṃ samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.41.eng: Thinking, “I won’t do such a thing,” one undertakes to train in the training rules for life.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.42.pli: Kati atthavase paṭicca bhagavatā paṭhamaṃ pārājikaṃ paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.42.eng: “For how many reasons did the Buddha lay down the first offense entailing expulsion?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.43.pli: Dasa atthavase paṭicca bhagavatā paṭhamaṃ pārājikaṃ paññattaṃ—
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.43.eng: He laid it down for the following ten reasons:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.44.pli: saṅghasuṭṭhutāya, saṅghaphāsutāya, dummaṅkūnaṃ puggalānaṃ niggahāya, pesalānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ phāsuvihārāya, diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ āsavānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ āsavānaṃ paṭighātāya, appasannānaṃ pasādāya, pasannānaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya, saddhammaṭṭhitiyā, vinayānuggahāya.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.44.eng: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of good monks, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.46.eng: They are the trainees and the good ordinary people.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.52.comm: Sp 5.2: Yesaṁ vattatīti yesaṁ vinayapiṭakañca aṭṭhakathā ca sabbā paguṇāti attho, “Yesaṁ vattati means for those who learn the whole collection of Monastic Law and the commentaries.”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:3.54.eng: It was the pronouncement of the Buddha, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:4.4.eng: These were in India, the land named after the glorious rose apple.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:4.4.comm: Vmv 1.1: Jambusirivhayeti jambusadiso sirimanto avhayo nāmaṁ yassa dīpassa, tasmiṁ jambudīpeti vuttaṁ hoti, “Jambusirivhaye: this is said: in that rose-apple land that is like a glorious rose apple and is so-called, so-named.”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:5.3.eng: And the wise one named Bhadda.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:6.1.eng: These mighty beings of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:6.3.eng: They taught the Collection on Monastic Law,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:7.1.eng: And the five Collections of Discourses,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:7.2.eng: And the seven works of philosophy;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:7.2.comm: Sp-ṭ 1.0: Satta ceva pakaraṇeti dhammasaṅgaṇīvibhaṅgādike satta abhidhammappakaraṇe ca vācesunti attho “Satta ceva pakaraṇe: it means they also taught the seven treatises of philosophy, starting with the Dhammasaṅgaṇī and the Vibhaṅga.”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:8.2.eng: And the senior monk named Dīgha;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:9.2.eng: And the senior monk Nāga, Buddharakkhita;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:9.3.eng: And the discerning senior monk Tissa,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:9.4.eng: And the wise senior monk Deva.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:11.3.eng: His student Khema of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:11.4.eng: A master of the three Collections.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:12.1.eng: Like the king of the stars on the island,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:12.2.eng: He outshone others in his wisdom;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:14.4.eng: Skilled in the tradition of the true Teaching.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:15.3.eng: And the discerning senior monk Tissa,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:17.3.eng: And the discerning senior monk Tissa,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:17.4.eng: Skilled in the tradition of the true Teaching.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:18.3.eng: And the discerning senior monk Siva,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:18.4.eng: Skilled in the entire Monastic Law—

pli-tv-pvr1.1:19.1.eng: These mighty beings of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:19.2.eng: Knowers of the Monastic Law and skilled in the path;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:19.3.eng: Proclaimed the Collection of Monastic Law,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:19.4.eng: On the island of Sri Lanka.”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dutiyaṃ pārājikaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.1.eng: “The second offense entailing expulsion was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.6.pli: Dhaniyo kumbhakāraputto rañño dārūni adinnaṃ ādiyi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.6.eng: Dhaniya stealing timber from the king.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.8.eng: “Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.10.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.11.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.11.eng: from speech and mind, not from body; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:20.12.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:21.1.eng: “There is the third offense entailing expulsion. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:21.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū aññamaññaṃ jīvitā voropesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:21.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:21.8.eng: “Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:21.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:21.10.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:21.11.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:21.11.eng: from speech and mind, not from body; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:21.12.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.1.eng: “There is the fourth offense entailing expulsion. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.4.eng: The monks from the banks of the Vaggumudā.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.6.pli: Vaggumudātīriyā bhikkhū gihīnaṃ aññamaññassa uttarimanussadhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.6.eng: Those monks praising one another’s superhuman qualities to householders.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.8.eng: “Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.10.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.11.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.11.eng: from speech and mind, not from body; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:22.12.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:23.1.eng: The four offenses entailing expulsion are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.0.eng: 2. The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocentassa saṅghādiseso kattha paññatto?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.1.eng: “The offense entailing suspension for emitting semen by means of effort was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.4.eng: Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.5.eng: Is it a rule that applies everywhere or in a particular place?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.6.eng: Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common or not in common?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.7.eng: Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.8.eng: In which of the five ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it contained and included?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.9.eng: In which recitation is it included?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.10.eng: To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.11.eng: To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.12.eng: Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.14.eng: Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues is it settled?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.16.eng: What is the Monastic Code there? What is concerned with the Monastic Code there?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.17.pli: Kā vipatti, kā sampatti, kā paṭipatti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.17.eng: What is failure? What is success? What is the practice?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.18.pli: Kati atthavase paṭicca bhagavatā upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocentassa saṅghādiseso paññatto?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.18.eng: For how many reasons did the Buddha lay down the offense entailing suspension for emitting semen by means of effort?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:26.19.eng: Who are those who train? Who have finished the training?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocentassa saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.1.eng: “The offense entailing suspension for emitting semen by means of effort was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.6.pli: Āyasmā seyyasako hatthena upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.7.eng: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.8.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.16.eng: “In which of the five ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it contained and included?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.23.eng: The class of offenses entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.24.eng: “Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.26.eng: from body and mind, not from speech.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.27.eng: “To which of the four kinds of legal issues does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.32.eng: “What is the Monastic Law there? What is concerned with the Monastic Law there?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.33.eng: The rule is the Monastic Law. Its analysis is concerned with the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.34.eng: “What is the Monastic Code there? What is concerned with the Monastic Code there?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.35.eng: The rule is the Monastic Code. Its analysis is concerned with the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.41.pli: Na evarūpaṃ karissāmīti yāvajīvaṃ āpāṇakoṭikaṃ samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.41.eng: Thinking, “I won’t do such a thing,” one undertakes to train in the training rules for life.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.42.pli: Kati atthavase paṭicca bhagavatā upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocentassa saṅghādiseso paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.42.eng: “For how many reasons did the Buddha lay down the offense entailing suspension for emitting semen by means of effort?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.43.pli: Dasa atthavase paṭicca bhagavatā upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocentassa saṅghādiseso paññatto—
pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.43.eng: He laid it down for the following ten reasons:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.44.pli: saṅghasuṭṭhutāya, saṅghaphāsutāya, dummaṅkūnaṃ puggalānaṃ niggahāya, pesalānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ phāsuvihārāya, diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ āsavānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ āsavānaṃ paṭighātāya, appasannānaṃ pasādāya, pasannānaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya, saddhammaṭṭhitiyā, vinayānuggahāya.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.44.eng: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of good monks, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.46.eng: They are the trainees and the good ordinary people.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:27.54.eng: It was the pronouncement of the Buddha, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:28.4.eng: These were in India, the land named after the glorious rose apple.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:29.3.eng: And the wise one named Bhadda.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:30.1.eng: These mighty beings of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:30.3.eng: They taught the Collection on Monastic Law,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:31.1.eng: And the five Collections of Discourses,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:31.2.eng: And the seven works of philosophy;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:32.2.eng: And the senior monk named Dīgha;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:33.2.eng: And the senior monk Nāga, Buddharakkhita;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:33.3.eng: And the discerning senior monk Tissa,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:33.4.eng: And the wise senior monk Deva.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:35.3.eng: His student Khema of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:35.4.eng: A master of the three Collections.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:36.1.eng: Like the king of the stars on the island,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:36.2.eng: He outshone others in his wisdom;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:38.4.eng: Skilled in the tradition of the true Teaching.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:39.3.eng: And the discerning senior monk Tissa,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:41.3.eng: And the discerning senior monk Tissa,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:41.4.eng: Skilled in the tradition of the true Teaching.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:42.3.eng: And the discerning senior monk Siva,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:42.4.eng: Skilled in the entire Monastic Law—

pli-tv-pvr1.1:43.1.eng: These mighty beings of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:43.2.eng: Knowers of the Monastic Law and skilled in the path;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:43.3.eng: Proclaimed the Collection of Monastic Law,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:43.4.eng: On the island of Sri Lanka.”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:44.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjantassa saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:44.1.eng: “The offense entailing suspension for making physical contact with a woman was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:44.6.pli: Āyasmā udāyī mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:44.6.eng: Udāyī making physical contact with a woman.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:44.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:44.9.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:44.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:45.1.pli: Mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsantassa saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:45.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for speaking indecently to a woman. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:45.6.pli: Āyasmā udāyī mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:45.6.eng: Udāyī speaking indecently to a woman.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:45.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:45.9.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:45.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:45.10.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:45.10.eng: from speech and mind, not from body; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:45.11.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:46.1.pli: Mātugāmassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsantassa saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:46.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for encouraging a woman to satisfy one’s own desires. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:46.6.pli: Āyasmā udāyī mātugāmassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ abhāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:46.6.eng: Udāyī encouraging a woman to satisfy his own desires.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:46.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:46.9.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:46.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:46.10.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:46.10.eng: from speech and mind, not from body; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:46.11.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for acting as a matchmaker. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.6.pli: Āyasmā udāyī sañcarittaṃ samāpajji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.9.pli: siyā kāyato samuṭṭhāti, na vācato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.9.eng: from body, not from speech or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.10.pli: siyā vācato samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.10.eng: from speech, not from body or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.11.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca samuṭṭhāti, na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.11.eng: from body and speech, not from mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.12.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.12.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.13.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.13.eng: from speech and mind, not from body; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:47.14.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:48.1.pli: Saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kārāpentassa saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:48.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for having a hut built by means of begging. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:48.6.pli: Āḷavakā bhikkhū saññācikāya kuṭiyo kārāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:48.6.eng: Those monks having huts made by means of begging.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:48.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:49.1.pli: Mahallakaṃ vihāraṃ kārāpentassa saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:49.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for having a large dwelling built. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:49.6.pli: Āyasmā channo vihāravatthuṃ sodhento aññataraṃ cetiyarukkhaṃ chedāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:49.6.eng: Channa having a tree that served as a shrine felled to clear a site for a dwelling.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:49.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:50.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsentassa saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:50.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:50.6.pli: Mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:50.6.eng: Those monks groundlessly charging Venerable Dabba the Mallian with an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:50.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:51.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ aññabhāgiyassa adhikaraṇassa kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāya pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsentassa saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:51.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:51.6.pli: Mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ aññabhāgiyassa adhikaraṇassa kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāya pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:51.6.eng: Those monks charging Venerable Dabba the Mallian with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:51.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:52.1.pli: Saṅghabhedakassa bhikkhuno yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantassa saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:52.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for a monk who does not stop pursuing schism in the Sangha when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:52.6.pli: Devadatto samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkami, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:52.6.eng: Devadatta pursuing schism in a united Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:52.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:52.9.pli: kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:53.1.pli: Bhedānuvattakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantānaṃ saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:53.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for monks who do not stop siding with one who is pursuing schism in the Sangha when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:53.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū devadattassa saṅghabhedāya parakkamantassa anuvattakā ahesuṃ vaggavādakā, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:53.6.eng: Those monks siding with and supporting Devadatta’s pursuit of schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:53.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:53.9.pli: kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:54.1.pli: Dubbacassa bhikkhuno yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantassa saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:54.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for a monk who does not stop being difficult to correct when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:54.6.pli: Āyasmā channo bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ akāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:54.6.eng: Channa making himself incorrigible when legitimately spoken to by the monks.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:54.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:54.9.pli: kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:55.1.pli: Kuladūsakassa bhikkhuno yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantassa saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:55.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension for a monk who does not stop being a corrupter of families when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:55.6.pli: Assajipunabbasukā bhikkhū saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakatā bhikkhū chandagāmitā dosagāmitā mohagāmitā bhayagāmitā pāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:55.6.eng: Those monks, when the Sangha did a legal procedure of banishment against them, slandering the monks as acting out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, and fear.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:55.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:55.9.pli: kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:56.1.eng: The thirteen rules entailing suspension are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:59.3.eng: Difficult to correct, and corrupter of families—

pli-tv-pvr1.1:60.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena paṭhamo aniyato kattha paññatto?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:60.1.eng: “The first undetermined offense was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?

pli-tv-pvr1.1:60.4.pli: Atthi tattha paññatti, anupaññatti, anuppannapaññatti, sabbatthapaññatti padesapaññatti, sādhāraṇapaññatti asādhāraṇapaññatti, ekatopaññatti ubhatopaññatti, pañcannaṃ pātimokkhuddesānaṃ katthogadhaṃ kattha pariyāpannaṃ, katamena uddesena uddesaṃ āgacchati, catunnaṃ vipattīnaṃ katamā vipatti, sattannaṃ āpattikkhandhānaṃ katamo āpattikkhandho, channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ katihi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti, catunnaṃ adhikaraṇānaṃ katamaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ, sattannaṃ samathānaṃ katihi samathehi sammati, ko tattha vinayo, ko tattha abhivinayo, kiṃ tattha pātimokkhaṃ, kiṃ tattha adhipātimokkhaṃ, kā vipatti, kā sampatti, kā paṭipatti, kati atthavase paṭicca bhagavatā paṭhamo aniyato paññatto, ke sikkhanti, ke sikkhitasikkhā, kattha ṭhitaṃ, ke dhārenti, kassa vacanaṃ kenābhatanti.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:60.4.eng: Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule? Is it a rule that applies everywhere or in a particular place? Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common or not in common? Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both? In which of the five ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it contained and included? In which recitation is it included? To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong? To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong? Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate? To which of the four kinds of legal issues does it belong? Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues is it settled? What is the Monastic Law there? What is concerned with the Monastic Law there? What is the Monastic Code there? What is concerned with the Monastic Code there? What is failure? What is success? What is the practice? For how many reasons did the Buddha lay down the first undetermined offense? Who are those who train? Who have finished the training? Established in what? Who master it? Whose pronouncement was it? Who handed it down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena paṭhamo aniyato kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.1.eng: “The first undetermined offense was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.6.pli: Āyasmā udāyī mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho paṭicchanne āsane alaṅkammaniye nisajjaṃ kappesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.6.eng: Udāyī sitting down in private alone with a woman on a concealed seat suitable for the deed.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.7.eng: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.9.eng: There is no addition to the rule. There is no unprompted rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.10.eng: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere or in a particular place?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.12.eng: “Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common or not in common?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.14.eng: “Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.16.eng: “In which of the five ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it contained and included?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.20.eng: “To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.21.eng: It may be failure in morality or failure in conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.22.eng: “To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.23.pli: Siyā pārājikāpattikkhandho siyā saṅghādisesāpattikkhandho siyā pācittiyāpattikkhandho.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.23.eng: It may be in the class of offenses entailing expulsion, in the class of offenses entailing suspension, or in the class of offenses entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.24.eng: “Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.26.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.26.eng: from body and mind, not from speech.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.27.eng: “To which of the four kinds of legal issues does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.28.eng: Legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.29.eng: “Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues is it settled?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.31.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.31.eng: it may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or it may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.31.comm: That is, the three principles are resolution face-to-face, acting according to what has been admitted, and covering over as if with grass.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.32.pli: Ko tattha vinayo, ko tattha abhivinayoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.32.eng: “What is the Monastic Law there? What is concerned with the Monastic Law there?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.33.eng: The rule is the Monastic Law. Its analysis is concerned with the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.34.pli: Kiṃ tattha pātimokkhaṃ, kiṃ tattha adhipātimokkhanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.34.eng: “What is the Monastic Code there? What is concerned with the Monastic Code there?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.35.eng: The rule is the Monastic Code. Its analysis is concerned with the Monastic Code.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.41.pli: Na evarūpaṃ karissāmīti yāvajīvaṃ āpāṇakoṭikaṃ samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.41.eng: Thinking, “I won’t do such a thing,” one undertakes to train in the training rules for life.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.42.pli: Kati atthavase paṭicca bhagavatā paṭhamo aniyato paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.42.eng: “For how many reasons did the Buddha lay down the first undetermined offense?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.43.pli: Dasa atthavase paṭicca bhagavatā paṭhamo aniyato paññatto—
pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.43.eng: He laid it down for the following ten reasons:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.44.pli: saṅghasuṭṭhutāya, saṅghaphāsutāya, dummaṅkūnaṃ puggalānaṃ niggahāya, pesalānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ phāsuvihārāya, diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ āsavānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ āsavānaṃ paṭighātāya, appasannānaṃ pasādāya, pasannānaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya, saddhammaṭṭhitiyā, vinayānuggahāya.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.44.eng: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of good monks, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.46.eng: They are the trainees and the good ordinary people.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:61.54.eng: It was the pronouncement of the Buddha, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:62.4.eng: These were in India, the land named after the glorious rose apple.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:63.3.eng: And the wise one named Bhadda.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:64.1.eng: These mighty beings of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:64.3.eng: They taught the Collection on Monastic Law,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:65.1.eng: And the five Collections of Discourses,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:65.2.eng: And the seven works of philosophy;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:66.2.eng: And the senior monk named Dīgha;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:67.2.eng: And the senior monk Nāga, Buddharakkhita;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:67.3.eng: And the discerning senior monk Tissa,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:67.4.eng: And the wise senior monk Deva.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:69.3.eng: His student Khema of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:69.4.eng: A master of the three Collections.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:70.1.eng: Like the king of the stars on the island,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:70.2.eng: He outshone others in his wisdom;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:72.4.eng: Skilled in the tradition of the true Teaching.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:73.3.eng: And the discerning senior monk Tissa,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:75.3.eng: And the discerning senior monk Tissa,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:75.4.eng: Skilled in the tradition of the true Teaching.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:76.3.eng: And the discerning senior monk Siva,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:76.4.eng: Skilled in the entire Monastic Law—

pli-tv-pvr1.1:77.1.eng: These mighty beings of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:77.2.eng: Knowers of the Monastic Law and skilled in the path;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:77.3.eng: Proclaimed the Collection of Monastic Law,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:77.4.eng: On the island of Sri Lanka.”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dutiyo aniyato kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.1.eng: “The second undetermined offense was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.6.pli: Āyasmā udāyī mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.6.eng: Udāyī sitting down in private alone with a woman.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.7.eng: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.9.eng: There is no addition to the rule. There is no unprompted rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.10.eng: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere or in a particular place?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.12.eng: “Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common or not in common?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.14.eng: “Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.16.eng: “In which of the five ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it contained and included?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.20.eng: “To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.21.eng: It may be failure in morality or failure in conduct.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.22.eng: “To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.23.eng: It may be in the class of offenses entailing suspension, or in the class of offenses entailing confession.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.24.eng: “Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.26.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.26.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.27.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.27.eng: from speech and mind, not from body; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.28.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.29.eng: “To which of the four kinds of legal issues does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.30.eng: Legal issues arising from an offense.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.31.eng: “Through how many of the seven principles for settling legal issues is it settled?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.33.pli: siyā sammukhāvinayena ca paṭiññātakaraṇena ca, siyā sammukhāvinayena ca tiṇavatthārakena ca …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:78.33.eng: it may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by acting according to what has been admitted; or it may be settled by resolution face-to-face and by covering over as if with grass. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:79.1.eng: The two undetermined offense are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:81.3.eng: The undetermined offenses have been well laid down,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:81.4.eng: By the Stable One, the Buddha who is the best.”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:82.0.2.eng: The subchapter on the robe season

pli-tv-pvr1.1:82.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena atirekacīvaraṃ dasāhaṃ atikkāmentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:82.1.eng: “The offense entailing relinquishment and confession for keeping an extra robe more than ten days that was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:82.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:82.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū atirekacīvaraṃ dhāresuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:82.6.eng: Those monks keeping an extra robe.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:82.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:82.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:82.9.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca samuṭṭhāti, na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:82.9.eng: from body and speech, not from mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:82.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:83.1.pli: Ekarattaṃ ticīvarena vippavasantassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:83.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for staying apart from one’s three robes for one day. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:83.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū bhikkhūnaṃ hatthe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā santaruttarena janapadacārikaṃ pakkamiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:83.6.eng: Those monks storing one of their robes with other monks and then leaving to wander the country in a sarong and an upper robe.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:83.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:83.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:83.9.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca samuṭṭhāti, na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:83.9.eng: from body and speech, not from mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:83.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:84.1.pli: Akālacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā māsaṃ atikkāmentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:84.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for receiving out-of-season robe-cloth and then keeping it for more than a month. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:84.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū akālacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā māsaṃ atikkāmesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:84.6.eng: Those monks receiving out-of-season robe-cloth and then keeping it for more than a month.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:84.7.comm: MS says there is one addition to the rule, ekā anupaññatti, which is incorrect. I follow SRT, which has the correct reading.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:84.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:84.9.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca samuṭṭhāti, na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:84.9.eng: from body and speech, not from mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:84.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:85.1.pli: Aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:85.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for having an unrelated nun wash a used robe. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:85.6.pli: Āyasmā udāyī aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:85.6.eng: Udāyī having an unrelated nun wash a used robe.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:85.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:86.1.pli: Aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā hatthato cīvaraṃ paṭiggaṇhantassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:86.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for receiving a robe directly from an unrelated nun. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:86.6.pli: Āyasmā udāyī aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā hatthato cīvaraṃ paṭiggahesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:86.6.eng: Udāyī receiving a robe directly from an unrelated nun.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:86.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:86.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:87.1.pli: Aññātakaṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatāniṃ vā cīvaraṃ viññāpentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:87.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for asking an unrelated male or female householder for a robe. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:87.6.pli: Āyasmā upanando sakyaputto aññātakaṃ seṭṭhiputtaṃ cīvaraṃ viññāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:87.6.eng: Upananda asking the son of an unrelated merchant for a robe.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:87.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:87.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:88.1.pli: Aññātakaṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatāniṃ vā tatuttari cīvaraṃ viññāpentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:88.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for asking an unrelated male or female householder for too many robes. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:88.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:88.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū na mattaṃ jānitvā bahuṃ cīvaraṃ viññāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:88.6.eng: Those monks not knowing moderation and asking for many robes.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:88.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:89.1.pli: Pubbe appavāritassa aññātakaṃ gahapatikaṃ upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjantassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:89.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for, without first being invited, going to an unrelated householder and specifying the kind of robe-cloth one wants. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:89.6.pli: Āyasmā upanando sakyaputto pubbe appavārito aññātakaṃ gahapatikaṃ upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:89.6.eng: Upananda, without first being invited, going to an unrelated householder and specifying the kind of robe-cloth he wanted.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:89.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:90.1.pli: Pubbe appavāritassa aññātake gahapatike upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjantassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:90.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for, without first being invited, going to unrelated householders and specifying the kind of robe-cloth one wants. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:90.6.pli: Āyasmā upanando sakyaputto pubbe appavārito aññātake gahapatike upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:90.6.eng: Upananda, without first being invited, going to unrelated householders and specifying the kind of robe-cloth he wanted.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:90.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:91.1.pli: Atirekatikkhattuṃ codanāya atirekachakkhattuṃ ṭhānena cīvaraṃ abhinipphādentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:91.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for getting robe-cloth after prompting more than three times and standing more than six times. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:91.6.eng: Upananda not agreeing when asked by a lay follower to wait for one day.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:91.7.pli: “ajjaṇho, bhante, āgamehī”ti vuccamāno nāgamesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:91.9.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:92.1.eng: The first subchapter on the robe season is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:93.1.pli: Kosiyamissakaṃ santhataṃ kārāpentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:93.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for having a blanket made that contains silk. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:93.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:93.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kosiyakārake upasaṅkamitvā evamāhaṃsu “bahū, āvuso, kosakārake pacatha.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:93.6.eng: Those monks going to the silk-makers and saying, “Please boil a heap of silkworms

pli-tv-pvr1.1:93.8.pli: Mayampi icchāma kosiyamissakaṃ santhataṃ kātun”ti, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:93.8.eng: We want to make a blanket containing silk.”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:93.10.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:94.1.pli: Suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:94.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for having a blanket made entirely of black wool. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:94.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:94.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:94.6.eng: Those monks having a blanket made entirely of black wool.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:94.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:95.1.pli: Anādiyitvā tulaṃ odātānaṃ tulaṃ gocariyānaṃ navaṃ santhataṃ kārāpentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:95.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for having a new blanket made without using one measure of white wool and one measure of brown. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:95.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:95.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū thokaññeva odātaṃ ante ādiyitvā tatheva suddhakāḷakānaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ santhataṃ kārāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:95.6.eng: Those monks adding just a little bit of white on the edge, effectively having a blanket made entirely of black wool.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:95.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:96.1.pli: Anuvassaṃ santhataṃ kārāpentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:96.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for having a blanket made every year. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:96.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū anuvassaṃ santhataṃ kārāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:96.6.eng: Those monks having a blanket made every year.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:96.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:96.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:97.1.pli: Anādiyitvā purāṇasanthatassa sāmantā sugatavidatthiṃ navaṃ nisīdanasanthataṃ kārāpentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:97.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for having a new sitting blanket made without incorporating a piece of one standard handspan from the border of an old blanket. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:97.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū santhatāni ujjhitvā āraññikaṅgaṃ piṇḍapātikaṅgaṃ paṃsukūlikaṅgaṃ samādiyiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:97.6.eng: Those monks discarding their blankets and undertaking the practice of staying in the wilderness, of eating only almsfood, and of wearing rag-robes.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:97.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:98.1.pli: Eḷakalomāni paṭiggahetvā tiyojanaṃ atikkāmentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:98.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for receiving wool and then taking it more than 40 kilometers. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:98.6.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu eḷakalomāni paṭiggahetvā tiyojanaṃ atikkāmesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:98.6.eng: That monk receiving wool and then taking it more than 40 kilometers.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:98.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:98.9.pli: siyā kāyato samuṭṭhāti, na vācato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:98.9.eng: from body, not from speech or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:98.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:98.10.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:99.1.pli: Aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā eḷakalomāni dhovāpentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:99.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for having an unrelated nun wash wool. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:99.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:99.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū aññātikāhi bhikkhunīhi eḷakalomāni dhovāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:99.6.eng: Those monks having wool washed by unrelated nuns.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:99.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:100.1.pli: Rūpiyaṃ paṭiggaṇhantassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:100.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for receiving money. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:100.6.pli: Āyasmā upanando sakyaputto rūpiyaṃ paṭiggahesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:100.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:101.1.pli: Nānappakārakaṃ rūpiyasaṃvohāraṃ samāpajjantassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:101.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for engaging in various kinds of trades involving money. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:101.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:101.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū nānappakārakaṃ rūpiyasaṃvohāraṃ samāpajjiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:101.6.eng: Those monks engaging in various kinds of trades involving money.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:101.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:102.1.pli: Nānappakārakaṃ kayavikkayaṃ samāpajjantassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:102.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for engaging in in various kinds of barter. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:102.6.pli: Āyasmā upanando sakyaputto paribbājakena saddhiṃ kayavikkayaṃ samāpajji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:102.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:103.1.eng: The second subchapter on silk is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:104.1.pli: Atirekapattaṃ dasāhaṃ atikkāmentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:104.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for keeping an extra almsbowl for more than ten days. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:104.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:104.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū atirekapattaṃ dhāresuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:104.6.eng: Those monks keeping an extra bowl.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:104.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:104.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:104.9.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca samuṭṭhāti, na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:104.9.eng: from body and speech, not from mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:104.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:105.1.pli: Ūnapañcabandhanena pattena aññaṃ navaṃ pattaṃ cetāpentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:105.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for exchanging an almsbowl with fewer than five mends for a new almsbowl. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:105.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:105.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū appamattakenapi bhinnena appamattakenapi khaṇḍena vilikhitamattenapi bahū patte viññāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:105.6.eng: Those monks asking for many bowls even when their existing almsbowls only had a minor chip or scratch.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:105.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:106.1.pli: Bhesajjāni paṭiggahetvā sattāhaṃ atikkāmentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:106.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for receiving tonics and then keeping them for more than seven days. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:106.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū bhesajjāni paṭiggahetvā sattāhaṃ atikkāmesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:106.6.eng: Those monks receiving tonics and then keeping them for more than seven days.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:106.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti kathinake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:106.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:107.1.pli: Atirekamāse sese gimhāne vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyesantassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:107.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for looking for a rainy-season robe when there is more than a month left of summer. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:107.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:107.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū atirekamāse sese gimhāne vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyesiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:107.6.eng: Those monks looking for a rainy-season robe when there was more than a month left of summer.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:107.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:108.1.pli: Bhikkhussa sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ datvā kupitena anattamanena acchindantassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:108.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for giving a robe to a monk and then taking it back in anger. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:108.6.pli: Āyasmā upanando sakyaputto bhikkhussa sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ datvā kupito anattamano acchindi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:108.6.eng: Upananda giving a robe to a monk and then taking it back in anger.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:108.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:109.1.pli: Sāmaṃ suttaṃ viññāpetvā tantavāyehi cīvaraṃ vāyāpentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:109.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for asking for thread and then having weavers weave robe-cloth. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:109.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:109.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sāmaṃ suttaṃ viññāpetvā tantavāyehi cīvaraṃ vāyāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:109.6.eng: Those monks asking for thread and then having weavers weave robe-cloth.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:109.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:110.1.pli: Pubbe appavāritassa aññātakassa gahapatikassa tantavāye upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajjantassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:110.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for going, without first being invited, to an unrelated householder’s weavers and then specifying the kind of robe-cloth one wants. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:110.6.pli: Āyasmā upanando sakyaputto pubbe appavārito aññātakassa gahapatikassa tantavāye upasaṅkamitvā cīvare vikappaṃ āpajji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:110.6.eng: Upananda going, without first being invited, to an unrelated householder’s weavers and then specifying the kind of robe-cloth he wanted.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:110.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:111.1.pli: Accekacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā cīvarakālasamayaṃ atikkāmentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:111.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for receiving a haste-cloth and then keeping it beyond the robe season. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:111.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū accekacīvaraṃ paṭiggahetvā cīvarakālasamayaṃ atikkāmesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:111.6.eng: Those monks receiving a haste-cloth and then keeping it beyond the robe season.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:111.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti kathinake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:111.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:112.1.pli: Tiṇṇaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ antaraghare nikkhipitvā atirekachārattaṃ vippavasantassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:112.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for storing one of one’s three robes in an inhabited area and then staying apart from it for more than six days. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:112.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū tiṇṇaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ antaraghare nikkhipitvā atirekachārattaṃ vippavasiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:112.6.eng: Those monks storing one of their three robes in an inhabited area and then staying apart from it for more than six days.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:112.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti kathinake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:112.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:113.1.pli: Jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ attano pariṇāmentassa nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:113.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing relinquishment and confession for diverting to oneself material support that one knows was intended for the Sangha. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:113.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:113.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ attano pariṇāmesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:113.6.eng: Those monks diverting to themselves material support that they knew was intended for the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:113.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:114.1.eng: The third subchapter on almsbowls is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:114.2.eng: The thirty rules on relinquishment and confession are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:116.3.eng: Unrelated, and that one, for the sake of;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:117.3.eng: And two on wool, should take,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:118.2.eng: Rainy season, the fifth on a gift;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:119.0.1.eng: 5. The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-pvr1.1:119.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena sampajānamusāvāde pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:119.1.eng: “The offense entailing confession for lying in full awareness was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:119.6.pli: Āyasmā hatthako sakyaputto titthiyehi saddhiṃ sallapanto avajānitvā paṭijāni, paṭijānitvā avajāni, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:119.6.eng: Hatthaka, when talking with the monastics of other religions, asserting things after denying them and denying things after asserting them.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:119.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:119.9.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:119.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:119.10.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:119.10.eng: from speech and mind, not from body; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:119.11.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:120.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for speaking abusively. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:120.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:120.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū pesalehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ bhaṇḍantā pesale bhikkhū omasiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:120.6.eng: Those monks arguing with and abusing good monks.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:120.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:121.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for malicious talebearing between monks. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:121.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:121.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ pesuññaṃ upasaṃhariṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:121.6.eng: Those monks engaging in malicious talebearing between monks who were arguing.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:121.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:122.1.pli: Anupasampannaṃ padaso dhammaṃ vācentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:122.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for instructing a person who is not fully ordained to memorize the Teaching. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:122.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:122.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū upāsake padaso dhammaṃ vācesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:122.6.eng: Those monks instructing lay followers to memorize the Teaching.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:122.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:122.9.pli: siyā vācato samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:122.9.eng: from speech, not from body or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:122.10.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:122.10.eng: from speech and mind, not from body. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:123.1.pli: Anupasampannena uttaridirattatirattaṃ sahaseyyaṃ kappentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:123.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for lying down more than two or three nights in the same sleeping place as a person who is not fully ordained. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:123.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū anupasampannena sahaseyyaṃ kappesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:123.6.eng: Those monks lying down in the same sleeping place as a person who was not fully ordained.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:123.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:123.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:123.9.pli: siyā kāyato samuṭṭhāti, na vācato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:123.9.eng: from body, not from speech or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:123.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:123.10.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:124.1.pli: Mātugāmena sahaseyyaṃ kappentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:124.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for lying down in the same sleeping place as a woman. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:124.6.pli: Āyasmā anuruddho mātugāmena sahaseyyaṃ kappesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:124.6.eng: Anuruddha lying down in the same sleeping place as a woman.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:124.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti eḷakalomake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:124.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on wool) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:125.1.pli: Mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ desentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:125.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving a teaching of more than five or six sentences to a woman. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:125.6.pli: Āyasmā udāyī mātugāmassa dhammaṃ desesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:125.6.eng: Udāyī giving a teaching of more than five or six sentences to a woman.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:125.7.eng: There is one rule. There are two additions to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:125.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti padasodhamme …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:125.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on memorizing the Teaching) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:126.1.pli: Anupasampannassa uttarimanussadhammaṃ bhūtaṃ ārocentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:126.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for truthfully telling a person who is not fully ordained of a superhuman quality. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:126.4.eng: The monks from the banks of the Vaggumudā.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:126.6.pli: Vaggumudātīriyā bhikkhū gihīnaṃ aññamaññassa uttarimanussadhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:126.6.eng: Those monks praising one another’s superhuman qualities to householders.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:126.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:126.9.pli: siyā kāyato samuṭṭhāti, na vācato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:126.9.eng: from body, not from speech or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:126.10.pli: siyā vācato samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:126.10.eng: from speech, not from body or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:126.11.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca samuṭṭhāti, na cittato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:126.11.eng: from body and speech, not from mind. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:127.1.pli: Bhikkhussa duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ anupasampannassa ārocentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:127.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for telling a person who is not fully ordained about a monk’s grave offense. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:127.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:127.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhussa duṭṭhullāpattiṃ anupasampannassa ārocesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:127.6.eng: Those monks telling a person who is not fully ordained about a monk’s grave offense.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:127.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:128.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for digging the earth. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:128.6.pli: Āḷavakā bhikkhū pathaviṃ khaṇiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:128.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:129.1.eng: The first subchapter on lying is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:130.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for destroying a plant. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:130.6.pli: Āḷavakā bhikkhū rukkhaṃ chindiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:130.6.eng: Those monks cutting down a tree.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:130.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:131.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for speaking evasively or harassing. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:131.6.pli: Āyasmā channo saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjiyamāno aññenaññaṃ paṭicari, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:131.6.eng: Channa speaking evasively when examined about an offense in the midst of the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:131.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:131.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:132.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for complaining or criticizing. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:132.6.pli: Mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ bhikkhū ujjhāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:132.6.eng: Those monks complaining to monks about Venerable Dabba the Mallian.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:132.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:132.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:133.1.pli: Saṅghikaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā bhisiṃ vā kocchaṃ vā ajjhokāse santharitvā anuddharitvā anāpucchā pakkamantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:133.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for taking a bed, a bench, a mattress, or a stool belonging to the Sangha and putting it outside, and then departing without putting it away or informing anyone. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:133.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū saṅghikaṃ senāsanaṃ ajjhokāse santharitvā anuddharitvā anāpucchā pakkamiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:133.6.eng: Those monks taking furniture belonging to the Sangha outside and then departing without putting it away or informing anyone.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:133.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:133.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti kathinake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:133.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:134.1.pli: Saṅghike vihāre seyyaṃ santharitvā anuddharitvā anāpucchā pakkamantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:134.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for putting out bedding in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, and then departing without putting it away or informing anyone. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:134.4.eng: The monks from the group of seventeen.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:134.6.pli: Sattarasavaggiyā bhikkhū saṅghike vihāre seyyaṃ santharitvā anuddharitvā anāpucchā pakkamiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:134.6.eng: Those monks putting out bedding in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, and then departing without putting it away or informing anyone.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:134.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti kathinake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:134.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:135.1.pli: Saṅghike vihāre jānaṃ pubbupagataṃ bhikkhuṃ anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:135.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for arranging one’s sleeping place, in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha, in a way that encroaches on a monk that one knows arrived there before oneself. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:135.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:135.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū there bhikkhū anupakhajja seyyaṃ kappesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:135.6.eng: Those monks arranging their sleeping places in a way that encroached on the senior monks.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:135.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:135.9.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:135.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:136.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ kupitena anattamanena saṅghikā vihārā nikkaḍḍhantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:136.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for angrily throwing a monk out of a dwelling belonging to the Sangha. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:136.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:136.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kupitā anattamanā bhikkhū saṅghikā vihārā nikkaḍḍhiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:136.6.eng: Those monks angrily throwing monks out of a dwelling belonging to the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:136.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:137.1.pli: Saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā abhinisīdantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:137.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for sitting down on a bed or a bench with detachable legs on an upper story in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:137.6.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu saṅghike vihāre uparivehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṃ mañcaṃ sahasā abhinisīdi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:137.6.eng: That monk sitting down hastily on a bed with detachable legs on an upper story in a dwelling belonging to the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:137.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:137.9.pli: siyā kāyato samuṭṭhāti, na vācato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:137.9.eng: from body, not from speech or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:137.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:137.10.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:138.1.pli: Dvattipariyāye adhiṭṭhahitvā tatuttari adhiṭṭhahantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:138.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for applying more than two or three courses. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:138.6.pli: Āyasmā channo katapariyositaṃ vihāraṃ punappunaṃ chādāpesi, punappunaṃ limpāpesi, atibhāriko vihāro paripati, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:138.6.eng: Channa having a finished dwelling roofed and plastered over and over, so that it collapsed from overloading.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:138.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:139.1.pli: Jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ tiṇaṃ vā mattikaṃ vā siñcantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:139.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for pouring water that one knows contains living beings onto grass or clay. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:139.6.pli: Āḷavakā bhikkhū jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ tiṇampi mattikampi siñciṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:139.6.eng: Those monks pouring water that they knew contained living beings onto grass and clay.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:139.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:140.1.eng: The second subchapter on plants is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:141.1.pli: Asammatena bhikkhuniyo ovadantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:141.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for instructing the nuns without being appointed. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:141.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:141.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū asammatā bhikkhuniyo ovadiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:141.6.eng: Those monks instructing the nuns without being appointed.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:141.7.eng: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:141.8.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:141.10.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:141.11.pli: siyā vācato samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:141.11.eng: from speech, not from body or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:141.12.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:141.12.eng: from speech and mind, not from body. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:142.1.pli: Atthaṅgate sūriye bhikkhuniyo ovadantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:142.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for instructing the nuns after sunset. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:142.6.pli: Āyasmā cūḷapanthako atthaṅgate sūriye bhikkhuniyo ovadi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:142.6.eng: Cūlapanthaka instructing the nuns after sunset.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:142.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti padasodhamme …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:142.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on memorizing the Teaching) …
