pli-tv-pvr1.1:143.1.pli: Bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhuniyo ovadantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:143.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for going to the nuns’ dwelling place and instructing the nuns. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:143.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:143.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhunupassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhuniyo ovadiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:143.6.eng: Those monks going to the nuns’ dwelling place and instructing the nuns.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:143.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:143.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti kathinake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:143.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:144.1.pli: “Āmisahetu bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadantī”ti bhaṇantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:144.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for saying that the monks are instructing the nuns for the sake of worldly gain. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:144.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:144.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū “āmisahetu bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ovadantī”ti bhaṇiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:144.6.eng: Those monks saying that the monks were instructing the nuns for the sake of worldly gain.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:144.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:145.1.pli: Aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ dentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:145.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving robe-cloth to an unrelated nun. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:145.6.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ adāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:145.6.eng: That monk giving robe-cloth to an unrelated nun.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:145.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:145.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:146.1.pli: Aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ sibbentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:146.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for sewing a robe for an unrelated nun. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:146.6.pli: Āyasmā udāyī aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ sibbesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:146.6.eng: Udāyī sewing a robe for an unrelated nun.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:146.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:147.1.pli: Bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:147.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for traveling by arrangement with a nun. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:147.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:147.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:147.6.eng: Those monks traveling by arrangement with nuns.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:147.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:147.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in four ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:147.9.pli: siyā kāyato samuṭṭhāti, na vācato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:147.9.eng: from body, not from speech or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:147.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca samuṭṭhāti, na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:147.10.eng: from body and speech, not from mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:147.11.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:147.11.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:147.12.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:148.1.pli: Bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruhantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:148.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for boarding a boat by arrangement with a nun. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:148.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:148.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruhiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:148.6.eng: Those monks boarding a boat by arrangement with nuns.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:148.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:148.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in four ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:149.1.pli: Jānaṃ bhikkhuniparipācitaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:149.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for eating almsfood knowing that a nun had it prepared. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:149.6.pli: Devadatto jānaṃ bhikkhuniparipācitaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:149.6.eng: Devadatta eating almsfood knowing that a nun had it prepared.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:149.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:149.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:149.9.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:149.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:150.1.pli: Bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:150.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for sitting down in private alone with a nun. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:150.6.pli: Āyasmā udāyī bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:150.6.eng: Udāyī sitting down in private alone with a nun.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:150.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:150.9.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:150.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:151.1.eng: The third subchapter on the instruction is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:152.1.pli: Tatuttari āvasathapiṇḍaṃ bhuñjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:152.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for eating alms too often at a public guesthouse. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:152.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:152.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū anuvasitvā anuvasitvā āvasathapiṇḍaṃ bhuñjiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:152.6.eng: Those monks staying on and on, eating alms at a public guesthouse.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:152.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:152.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti eḷakalomake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:152.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on wool) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:153.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for eating in a group. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:153.6.pli: Devadatto sapariso kulesu viññāpetvā viññāpetvā bhuñji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:153.6.eng: Devadatta and his followers eating at invitations after repeatedly asking.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:153.7.eng: There is one rule. There are seven additions to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:153.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti eḷakalomake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:153.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on wool) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:154.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for eating one meal before another. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:154.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū aññatra nimantitā aññatra bhuñjiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:154.6.eng: Those monks eating elsewhere when invited for a meal.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:154.7.eng: There is one rule. There are four additions to the rule.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:154.7.comm: There are three additions that impact the wording of the rule, and one addition that establishes a method for assigning a meal to another.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:154.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti kathinake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:154.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:155.1.pli: Dvattipattapūre pūve paṭiggahetvā tatuttari paṭiggaṇhantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:155.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for accepting more than two or three bowlfuls of cookies. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:155.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū na mattaṃ jānitvā paṭiggahesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:155.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:156.1.pli: Bhuttāvinā pavāritena anatirittaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā bhuñjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:156.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for having finished one’s meal and refused an invitation to eat more, and then eating fresh or cooked food that is not left over. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:156.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū bhuttāvī pavāritā aññatra bhuñjiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:156.6.eng: Those monks having finished their meal and refused an invitation to eat more, and then eating elsewhere.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:156.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:156.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti kathinake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:156.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:157.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ bhuttāviṃ pavāritaṃ anatirittena khādanīyena vā bhojanīyena vā abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavārentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:157.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for inviting a monk who has finished his meal and refused an invitation to eat more to eat fresh or cooked food that is not left over. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:157.6.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ bhuttāviṃ pavāritaṃ anatirittena bhojanīyena abhihaṭṭhuṃ pavāresi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:157.6.eng: That monk inviting a monk who had finished his meal and refused an invitation to eat more to eat food that was not left over.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:157.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:158.1.pli: Vikāle khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā bhuñjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:158.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for eating fresh or cooked food at the wrong time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:158.4.eng: The monks from the group of seventeen.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:158.6.pli: Sattarasavaggiyā bhikkhū vikāle bhojanaṃ bhuñjiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:158.6.eng: Those monks eating at the wrong time.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:158.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti eḷakalomake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:158.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on wool) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:159.1.pli: Sannidhikārakaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā bhuñjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:159.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for storing and then eating fresh or cooked food. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:159.6.pli: Āyasmā belaṭṭhasīso sannidhikārakaṃ bhojanaṃ bhuñji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:159.6.eng: Belaṭṭhasīsa storing food and then eating it.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:159.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti eḷakalomake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:159.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on wool) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:160.1.pli: Paṇītabhojanāni attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:160.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for eating fine foods that one has requested for oneself. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:160.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:160.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū paṇītabhojanāni attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:160.6.eng: Those monks eating fine foods that they had requested for themselves.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:160.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:160.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in four ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:161.1.pli: Adinnaṃ mukhadvāraṃ āhāraṃ āharantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:161.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for eating food that has not been given. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:161.6.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu adinnaṃ mukhadvāraṃ āhāraṃ āhari, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:161.6.eng: That monk eating food that had not been given.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:161.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:161.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti eḷakalomake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:161.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on wool) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:162.1.eng: The fourth subchapter on eating is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:163.1.pli: Acelakassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:163.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for personally giving fresh or cooked food to a naked ascetic, to a male wanderer, or to a female wanderer. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:163.6.pli: Āyasmā ānando aññatarissā paribbājikāya ekaṃ maññamāno dve pūve adāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:163.6.eng: Ānanda giving two cookies, thinking they were one, to a certain a female wanderer.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:163.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti eḷakalomake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:163.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on wool) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:164.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ “ehāvuso, gāmaṃ vā nigamaṃ vā piṇḍāya pavisissāmā”ti tassa dāpetvā vā adāpetvā vā uyyojentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:164.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for saying to a monk, ‘Come, let’s go to the village or town for alms,’ and then, whether he has had food given to him or not, sending him away. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:164.6.pli: Āyasmā upanando sakyaputto bhikkhuṃ “ehāvuso, gāmaṃ piṇḍāya pavisissāmā”ti, tassa adāpetvā uyyojesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:164.6.eng: Upananda saying to a monk, “Come, let’s go to the village or town for alms,” and then, without having had food given to him, sending him away.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:164.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:165.1.pli: Sabhojane kule anupakhajja nisajjaṃ kappentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:165.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for sitting down intruding on a lustful couple. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:165.6.pli: Āyasmā upanando sakyaputto sabhojane kule anupakhajja nisajjaṃ kappesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:165.6.eng: Upananda sitting down intruding on a lustful couple.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:165.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:165.9.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:165.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:166.1.pli: Mātugāmena saddhiṃ raho paṭicchanne āsane nisajjaṃ kappentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:166.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for sitting down in private on a concealed seat with a woman. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:166.6.pli: Āyasmā upanando sakyaputto mātugāmena saddhiṃ raho paṭicchanne āsane nisajjaṃ kappesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:166.6.eng: Upananda sitting down in private on a concealed seat with a woman.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:166.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:166.9.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:166.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:167.1.pli: Mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:167.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for sitting down in private alone with a woman. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:167.6.pli: Āyasmā upanando sakyaputto mātugāmena saddhiṃ eko ekāya raho nisajjaṃ kappesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:167.6.eng: Upananda sitting down in private alone with a woman.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:167.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:167.9.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:167.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:168.1.pli: Nimantitena sabhattena santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā purebhattaṃ pacchābhattaṃ kulesu cārittaṃ āpajjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:168.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for being invited to a meal and then visiting families beforehand or afterwards without informing an available monk. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:168.6.pli: Āyasmā upanando sakyaputto nimantito sabhatto samāno purebhattaṃ pacchābhattaṃ kulesu cārittaṃ āpajji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:168.6.eng: Upananda having been invited to a meal and then visiting families beforehand and afterwards.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:168.7.eng: There is one rule. There are four additions to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:168.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti kathinake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:168.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:169.1.pli: Tatuttari bhesajjaṃ viññāpentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:169.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for asking for too many tonics. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:169.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:169.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū mahānāmena sakkena “ajjaṇho, bhante, āgamethā”ti vuccamānā nāgamesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:169.6.eng: Those monks not waiting for one day when asked by Mahānāma the Sakyan.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:169.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:170.1.pli: Uyyuttaṃ senaṃ dassanāya gacchantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:170.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for going to see an army. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:170.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:170.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū uyyuttaṃ senaṃ dassanāya agamaṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:170.6.eng: Those monks going to see an army.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:170.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:170.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti eḷakalomake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:170.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on wool) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:171.1.pli: Atirekatirattaṃ senāya vasantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:171.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for staying with the army for more than three nights. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:171.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:171.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū atirekatirattaṃ senāya vasiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:171.6.eng: Those monks staying with the army for more than three nights.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:171.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti eḷakalomake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:171.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on wool) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:172.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for going to a battle. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:172.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:172.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū uyyodhikaṃ agamaṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:172.6.eng: Those monks going to a battle.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:172.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti eḷakalomake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:172.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on wool) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:173.1.eng: The fifth subchapter on naked ascetics is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:174.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for drinking an alcoholic drink. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:174.6.pli: Āyasmā sāgato majjaṃ pivi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:174.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:174.9.pli: siyā kāyato samuṭṭhāti, na vācato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:174.9.eng: from body, not from speech or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:174.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:174.10.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:175.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for tickling. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:175.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:175.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ aṅgulipatodakena hāsesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:175.6.eng: Those monks tickling a monk to make him laugh.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:175.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:175.9.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:175.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:176.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for playing in water. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:176.4.eng: The monks from the group of seventeen.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:176.6.pli: Sattarasavaggiyā bhikkhū aciravatiyā nadiyā udake kīḷiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:176.6.eng: Those monks playing in the water of the river Aciravatī.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:176.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:176.9.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:176.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:177.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for disrespect. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:177.6.pli: Āyasmā channo anādariyaṃ akāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:177.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:178.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for scaring a monk. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:178.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:178.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ bhiṃsāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:178.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:179.1.pli: Jotiṃ samādahitvā visibbentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:179.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for lighting a fire and warming oneself. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:179.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū jotiṃ samādahitvā visibbesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:179.6.eng: Those monks warming themselves by lighting a fire.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:179.7.eng: There is one rule. There are two additions to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:179.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:180.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for bathing at intervals of less than a half-month. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:180.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū rājānampi passitvā na mattaṃ jānitvā nahāyiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:180.6.eng: Those monks bathing without moderation, even after seeing the king.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:180.7.eng: There is one rule. There are six additions to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:180.8.eng: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere or in a particular place?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:180.10.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti eḷakalomake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:180.10.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on wool) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:181.1.pli: Anādiyitvā tiṇṇaṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇānaṃ aññataraṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇaṃ navaṃ cīvaraṃ paribhuñjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:181.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for using a new robe without first applying one of the three kinds of stains. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:181.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū attano cīvaraṃ na sañjāniṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:181.6.eng: Those monks not recognizing their own robes.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:181.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti eḷakalomake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:181.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on wool) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:182.1.pli: Bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā sikkhamānāya vā sāmaṇerassa vā sāmaṇeriyā vā sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ vikappetvā appaccuddhāraṇaṃ paribhuñjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:182.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for assigning the ownership of a robe to a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice monk, or a novice nun, and then using it without the other first relinquishing it. Where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:182.1.comm: For an explanation of the idea of vikappanā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:182.6.pli: Āyasmā upanando sakyaputto bhikkhussa sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ vikappetvā appaccuddhāraṇaṃ paribhuñji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:182.6.eng: Upananda assigning the ownership of a robe to a monk and then using it without that monk first relinquishing it.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:182.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti kathinake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:182.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:183.1.pli: Bhikkhussa pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā nisīdanaṃ vā sūcigharaṃ vā kāyabandhanaṃ vā apanidhentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:183.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for hiding a monk’s bowl, robe, sitting mat, needle case, or belt. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:183.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:183.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhūnaṃ pattampi cīvarampi apanidhesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:183.6.eng: Those monks hiding other monks’ bowls and robes.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:183.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:184.1.eng: The sixth subchapter of alcoholic drinks is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:185.0.eng: The subchapter on containing living beings

pli-tv-pvr1.1:185.1.pli: Sañcicca pāṇaṃ jīvitā voropentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:185.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for intentionally killing a living being. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:185.6.pli: Āyasmā udāyī sañcicca pāṇaṃ jīvitā voropesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:185.6.eng: Udāyī intentionally killing a living being.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:185.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:186.1.pli: Jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ paribhuñjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:186.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for using water that one knows contains living beings. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:186.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:186.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ paribhuñjiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:186.6.eng: Those monks using water that they knew contained living beings.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:186.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:187.1.pli: Jānaṃ yathādhammaṃ nihatādhikaraṇaṃ puna kammāya ukkoṭentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:187.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for reopening a legal issue that one knows has been legitimately settled. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:187.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:187.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jānaṃ yathādhammaṃ nihatādhikaraṇaṃ puna kammāya ukkoṭesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:187.6.eng: Those monks reopening a legal issue that they knew had been legitimately settled.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:187.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:188.1.pli: Bhikkhussa jānaṃ duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ paṭicchādentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:188.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for knowingly concealing a monk’s grave offense. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:188.6.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu bhikkhussa jānaṃ duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ paṭicchādesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:188.6.eng: That monk knowingly concealing a monk’s grave offense.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:188.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:188.9.pli: kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:189.1.pli: Jānaṃ ūnavīsativassaṃ puggalaṃ upasampādentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:189.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving the full ordination to a person one knows is less than twenty years old. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:189.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū jānaṃ ūnavīsativassaṃ puggalaṃ upasampādesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:189.6.eng: Those monks giving the full ordination to a person they knew was less than twenty years old.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:189.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:190.1.pli: Jānaṃ theyyasatthena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:190.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for knowingly traveling by arrangement with a group of thieves. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:190.6.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu jānaṃ theyyasatthena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:190.6.eng: That monk knowingly traveling by arrangement with a group of thieves.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:190.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:190.9.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:190.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:190.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:191.1.pli: Mātugāmena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:191.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for traveling by arrangement with a woman. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:191.6.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu mātugāmena saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:191.6.eng: That monk traveling by arrangement with a woman.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:191.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in four ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:192.1.pli: Pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:192.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for not giving up a bad view when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:192.6.pli: Ariṭṭho bhikkhu gaddhabādhipubbo pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:192.6.eng: Ariṭṭha not giving up a bad view when pressed for the third time.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:192.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:192.9.pli: Kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:193.1.pli: Jānaṃ tathāvādinā bhikkhunā akaṭānudhammena taṃ diṭṭhiṃ appaṭinissaṭṭhena saddhiṃ sambhuñjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:193.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for living with a monk who one knows is saying such things, who has not made amends according to the rule, and who has not given up that view. Where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:193.1.comm: “Such things” and “that view” refer to the idea that sexual intercourse is not an obstacle to spiritual progress, see Bu Pc 68:1.49.1.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:193.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:193.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jānaṃ tathāvādinā ariṭṭhena bhikkhunā akaṭānudhammena taṃ diṭṭhiṃ appaṭinissaṭṭhena saddhiṃ sambhuñjiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:193.6.eng: Those monks living with the monk Ariṭṭha who they knew was saying such things, who had not made amends according to the rule, and who had not given up that view.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:193.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:194.1.pli: Jānaṃ tathānāsitaṃ samaṇuddesaṃ upalāpentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:194.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for befriending a novice monastic who one knows has been expelled in this way. Where was it laid down?”
pli-tv-pvr1.1:194.1.comm: For the meaning of “in this way”, see Bu Pc 70:1.46.1.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:194.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:194.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jānaṃ tathānāsitaṃ kaṇṭakaṃ samaṇuddesaṃ upalāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:194.6.eng: Those monks befriended the novice monastic Kaṇṭaka who they knew had been expelled in this way.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:194.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:195.1.eng: The seventh subchapter on containing living beings is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:196.1.pli: Bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamānena “na tāvāhaṃ, āvuso, etasmiṃ sikkhāpade sikkhissāmi yāva na aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ byattaṃ vinayadharaṃ paripucchissāmī”ti bhaṇantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:196.1.eng: “When legitimately corrected by the monks, there is an offense entailing confession for saying, ‘I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who is an expert on the Monastic Law.’ Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:196.6.pli: Āyasmā channo bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno “na tāvāhaṃ, āvuso, etasmiṃ sikkhāpade sikkhissāmi yāva na aññaṃ bhikkhuṃ byattaṃ vinayadharaṃ paripucchissāmī”ti bhaṇi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:196.6.eng: Channa, when legitimately corrected by the monks, saying, “I won’t practice this training rule until I’ve questioned a monk who is an expert on the Monastic Law”.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:196.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:197.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for disparaging the Monastic Law. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:197.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:197.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū vinayaṃ vivaṇṇesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:197.6.eng: Those monks disparaging the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:197.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:198.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for the act of deception. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:198.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:198.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:199.1.pli: Bhikkhussa kupitena anattamanena pahāraṃ dentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:199.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for hitting a monk in anger. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:199.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:199.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kupitā anattamanā bhikkhūnaṃ pahāraṃ adaṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:199.6.eng: Those monks hitting other monks in anger.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:199.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:199.9.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:199.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:200.1.pli: Bhikkhussa kupitena anattamanena talasattikaṃ uggirantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:200.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for raising a hand in anger against a monk. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:200.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:200.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū kupitā anattamanā bhikkhūnaṃ talasattikaṃ uggiriṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:200.6.eng: Those monks raising a hand in anger against other monks.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:200.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:200.9.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:200.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:201.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ amūlakena saṅghādisesena anuddhaṃsentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:201.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing suspension. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:201.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:201.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhuṃ amūlakena saṅghādisesena anuddhaṃsesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:201.6.eng: Those monks groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:201.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:202.1.pli: Bhikkhussa sañcicca kukkuccaṃ upadahantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:202.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for intentionally making a monk anxious. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:202.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:202.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhūnaṃ sañcicca kukkuccaṃ upadahiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:202.6.eng: Those monks intentionally making monks anxious.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:202.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:203.1.pli: Bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ upassutiṃ tiṭṭhantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:203.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for eavesdropping on monks who are arguing and disputing. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:203.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:203.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhūnaṃ bhaṇḍanajātānaṃ kalahajātānaṃ vivādāpannānaṃ upassutiṃ tiṭṭhahiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:203.6.eng: Those monks eavesdropping on monks who were arguing and disputing.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:203.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:203.9.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:203.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:203.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:204.1.pli: Dhammikānaṃ kammānaṃ chandaṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:204.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving one’s consent to legitimate legal procedures and then criticizing them afterwards. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:204.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:204.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū dhammikānaṃ kammānaṃ chandaṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:204.6.eng: Those monks giving their consent to legitimate legal procedures and then criticizing them afterwards.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:204.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:205.1.pli: Saṅghe vinicchayakathāya vattamānāya chandaṃ adatvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:205.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for, without first giving one’s consent, getting up from one’s seat and leaving while the Sangha is in the middle of a discussion. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:205.6.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu saṅghe vinicchayakathāya vattamānāya chandaṃ adatvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:205.6.eng: That monk getting up from his seat and leaving while the Sangha was in the middle of a discussion, without first giving his consent.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:205.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:205.9.pli: kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:206.1.pli: Samaggena saṅghena cīvaraṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:206.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for giving out a robe as part of a unanimous Sangha and then criticizing it afterwards. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:206.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:206.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū samaggena saṅghena cīvaraṃ datvā pacchā khīyanadhammaṃ āpajjiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:206.6.eng: Those monks giving out a robe as part of a unanimous Sangha and then criticizing it afterwards.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:206.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:207.1.pli: Jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ puggalassa pariṇāmentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:207.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for diverting to an individual material support that one knows was intended for the Sangha. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:207.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:207.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ puggalassa pariṇāmesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:207.6.eng: Those monks diverting to an individual material support that they knew was intended for the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:207.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:208.1.eng: The eighth subchapter on legitimately is finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:209.1.pli: Pubbe appaṭisaṃviditena rañño antepuraṃ pavisantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:209.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for entering the royal compound without first being announced. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:209.6.pli: Āyasmā ānando pubbe appaṭisaṃvidito rañño antepuraṃ pāvisi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:209.6.eng: Ānanda entering the royal compound without first being announced.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:209.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti kathinake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:209.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:210.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for picking up something precious. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:210.6.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu ratanaṃ uggahesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:210.6.eng: That monk picking up something precious.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:210.7.eng: There is one rule. There are two additions to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:210.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:211.1.pli: Santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā vikāle gāmaṃ pavisantassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:211.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for entering an inhabited area at the wrong time without informing an available monk. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:211.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:211.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū vikāle gāmaṃ pavisiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:211.6.eng: Those monks entering an inhabited area at the wrong time.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:211.7.eng: There is one rule. There are three additions to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:211.8.pli: Channaṃ āpattisamuṭṭhānānaṃ dvīhi samuṭṭhānehi samuṭṭhāti kathinake …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:211.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways: … (as in the rule on the robe season) …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:212.1.pli: Aṭṭhimayaṃ vā dantamayaṃ vā visāṇamayaṃ vā sūcigharaṃ kārāpentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:212.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for having a needle case made from bone, ivory, or horn. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:212.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū na mattaṃ jānitvā bahū sūcighare viññāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:212.6.eng: Those monks having no sense of moderation and asking for many needle cases.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:212.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:213.1.pli: Pamāṇātikkantaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā kārāpentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:213.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for having a bed or a bench made that exceeds the right height. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:213.6.pli: Āyasmā upanando sakyaputto ucce mañce sayi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:213.6.eng: Upananda sleeping on a high bed.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:213.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:214.1.pli: Mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā tūlonaddhaṃ kārāpentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:214.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for having a bed or a bench made upholstered with cotton down. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:214.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:214.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā tūlonaddhaṃ kārāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:214.6.eng: Those monks having a bed or a bench made upholstered with cotton down.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:214.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:215.1.pli: Pamāṇātikkantaṃ nisīdanaṃ kārāpentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:215.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for having a sitting mat made that exceeds the right size. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:215.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:215.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū appamāṇikāni nisīdanāni dhāresuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:215.6.eng: Those monks using inappropriately-sized sitting mats.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:215.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:215.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:216.1.pli: Pamāṇātikkantaṃ kaṇḍuppaṭicchādiṃ kārāpentassa pācittiyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:216.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing confession for having an itch-covering cloth made that exceeds the right size. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:216.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:232.0.eng: 6. The chapter on offenses entailing acknowledgment

pli-tv-pvr1.1:232.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā antaragharaṃ paviṭṭhāya hatthato khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjantassa pāṭidesanīyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:232.1.eng: “The offense entailing acknowledgment for eating fresh or cooked food that was received directly from an unrelated nun who had entered an inhabited area was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:232.6.pli: Aññataro bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā antaragharaṃ paviṭṭhāya hatthato āmisaṃ paṭiggahesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:232.6.eng: That monk receiving food directly from an unrelated nun who had entered an inhabited area.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:232.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:232.9.pli: siyā kāyato samuṭṭhāti, na vācato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:232.9.eng: from body, not from speech or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:232.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:232.10.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:233.1.pli: Bhikkhuniyā vosāsantiyā na nivāretvā bhuñjantassa pāṭidesanīyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:233.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing acknowledgment for eating without having restrained a nun who is giving directions. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:233.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:233.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo vosāsantiyo na nivāresuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:233.6.eng: Those monks not restraining a nun who was giving directions.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:233.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:233.9.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca samuṭṭhāti, na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:233.9.eng: from body and speech, not from mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:233.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:234.1.pli: Sekkhasammatesu kulesu khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjantassa pāṭidesanīyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:234.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing acknowledgment for eating fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it from families designated as ‘in training’. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:234.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū na mattaṃ jānitvā paṭiggahesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:234.6.eng: Those monks receiving with no sense of moderation.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:234.7.eng: There is one rule. There are two additions to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:234.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:234.9.pli: siyā kāyato samuṭṭhāti, na vācato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:234.9.eng: from body, not from speech or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:234.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.1:234.10.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.1:235.1.pli: Āraññakesu senāsanesu pubbe appaṭisaṃviditaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā ajjhārāme sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjantassa pāṭidesanīyaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.1:235.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing acknowledgment for eating fresh or cooked food after personally receiving it inside a wilderness monastery without first making an announcement. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:235.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū ārāme core paṭivasante nārocesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.1:235.6.eng: Those monks not informing that there were bandits staying in the monastery.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:235.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:235.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in two ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:235.9.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca samuṭṭhāti, na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.1:235.9.eng: from body and speech, not from mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.1:235.10.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.1:236.1.eng: The four offenses entailing acknowledgment are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:323.1.eng: Hands on hips, and covered head,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:323.2.eng: Squatting on the heels, and clasping the knees;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:323.3.eng: Respectfully, and attention on the bowl,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:323.4.eng: The right proportion of bean curry, an even level.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:324.1.eng: Respectfully, and attention on the bowl,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:324.2.eng: In order, the right proportion of bean curry;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:327.2.eng: The Buddhas do not give the true Teaching;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:327.3.eng: Nor to one holding a staff,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:328.2.eng: And to one in a vehicle, and to one lying down;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:328.3.eng: To one seated clasping their knees,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:328.4.eng: To one with a headdress, and to one with a covered head.

pli-tv-pvr1.1:329.1.eng: The ground, on a low seat, standing,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:329.2.eng: Behind, and next to the path;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:329.3.eng: Not to be done while standing,

pli-tv-pvr1.1:329.4.eng: On cultivated plants, and in water.”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:330.1.eng: This is the summary of the subchapters:

pli-tv-pvr1.1:331.2.eng: Hands on hips, and also almsfood;

pli-tv-pvr1.1:331.4.eng: And with shoe as the seventh.”

pli-tv-pvr1.1:332.1.eng: The questions and answers on the monks’ Pātimokkha rules and their analysis in the Great Analysis are finished.
